reason: We have clients experiencing homelessness who have very limited clothes and need to wash and dry them regularly. We have even had people with clothes stolen from the washing line at the centre, so this would really help.
instructions: Please contact us for more details or to arrange delivery by emailing secretary_stuc@hotmail.co.uk or calling us on 0161 789 2999.
serviceProviderSynopsis: SUCRC offers practical solutions to the issues local people face, such as advice on benefits, links to credit unions and informal education sessions.
customMessage: Washer dryer needed for clothes of clients who are homeless at @SalfordUCRC

description: Laptops required for use by our community members
reason:
Emmaus Mossley supports a community of 26 formerly homeless people, offering a home and work in a social enterprise. 

We are currently appealling for upto 10 laptop computers or iPads for our community members to use for their training and personal development. Many of the public services, application forms and learning opportunities now exist exclusively online so it essential that our community members have the skills, knowledge and equipment to access those effectively.

Some of our current stock of usable computers are approaching the end of their life and we are keen to replace these with faster and more appropriate equipment. If your organisation is looking to replace computer equipment then we would give a worthwhile second life to your old machines.
serviceProviderSynopsis: Emmaus Mossley is a charity that supports 26 formerly homeless people by providing them with a home and work in a community setting.
customMessage: Laptops required for use by companions @emmausmossley

reason: Circles of Support and Accountability are support groups formed by volunteers from the community who work with convicted sex offenders to help change their lives and give them the support they need to stop them committing further crimes. In Greater Manchester, Circles of Support and Accountability change lives, stops abuse and protects victims.
instructions:
Volunteers are vital to the success of Circles of Support and Accountability. Without
them, there would be no Circles programme.

Our volunteers undertake rigorous screening and training to ensure that the work is right for them. We know that sexual abuse provokes powerful responses within
communities. But our volunteers are chosen for their ability and desire to see offenders successfully rehabilitate and reintegrate into their communities.

Volunteers in a Circle are given a brief outline of the offender’s behaviour and risk factors prior to meeting with them. At the first meeting with the offender, each member of the Circle (including the offender) is asked to commit to a Circles Agreement.

Volunteers help offenders to keep to their relapse prevention plan, by offering practical and emotional support. The Circle will meet once a week, and later in the life of the Circle, the contact will usually reduce and pairs of volunteers may meet with the offender instead of the whole Circle.

For more information, please contact Chris Kania on 0161 856 3636.
serviceProviderSynopsis: Help for ex-offenders

serviceProviderSynopsis: BYPHS supports young people aged 16 - 25. We prevent homelessness and enable independent living.

description: New or good condition bedding: single sheets, duvets, duvet covers, pillows and pillow cases
reason:
We are relaunching our Snug as a Bug campaign. We have very few bedding sets left and need single bedding, sheets, duvets, duvet covers, pillows and pillow cases. The young people who are homeless come to us with little or no possessions. They all get new single beds from us but we have no bedding. It needs to be age appropriate, no Power Rangers or Barbie! It needs to be new or used but cleaned. Can you set up a campaign in your workplace or neighbourhood to help our residents keep snug and have a decent standard of living? 

Please see here for more info: http://www.byphs.org.uk/snug-bug-campaign/
instructions: Please ring 01204 520183 if you can help or donate directly to our office at Trinity House, Breightmet Street, Bolton, BL2 1BR
serviceProviderSynopsis: BYPHS supports young people aged 16 - 25. We prevent homelessness and enable independent living.

description: Toys, furniture, soft furnishings, garden tools, lamps, TV's,Kitchen appliances,DVD players
reason: We have fourteen charity shops all over Greater Manchester, stocking a wide range of quality pre-loved clothes, accessories, books, toys, furniture and homeware as well as new gifts and cards, at very reasonable prices. Donating to our charity shops will help us to deliver the best care possible.
instructions:
Take items to one of our charity shops during opening hours:

https://www.sah.org.uk/get-involved/shop/our-shops/

Please do not leave bags outside the shops when they are closed.
Drop off your items at the donation stations at one of our hospice sites.
Arrange a collection by contacting us on 0161 477 7839 or for large items or furniture donations call 0161 445 7990.

All furniture items must be in good condition, clean and complete, and (where appropriate) that they work correctly.

All upholstered furniture must have a fire label attached. For sets, i.e. a three piece suite, dining chairs etc., each individual item must have its own fire label.
White goods must be in good condition.

Due to the cost of providing a collection service we can only collect furniture that is suitable for sale in our specialist shops. Our drivers are briefed on items that are suitable so please do not be offended if we are unable to accept your donation at point of collection.

We are unable to accept items that are ripped, torn or stained and furniture showing evidence of woodworm.
serviceProviderSynopsis: St Ann’s Hospice is Greater Manchester’s largest hospice.

reason: We are looking for seven churches to host the new women's night shelters for destitute refugees and asylum seekers next winter, one for each night of the week. Could this be for you and your church?
instructions:
The BNS will be open from early evening to 9am at the church. Simple ground mats and sleeping bags with washable liners will be provided, as well as pillows and pillow cases. There’ll be a hot meal each night, and breakfast will be available before departure. Some churches offer activities, ranging from a projector and screen to watch TV, to table tennis or craft.

The BNS is only for destitute asylum seekers and refugees, and access is by referral only. Those staying at the BNS are assessed for suitability. It is hoped that we will be able to find suitable move-on accommodation for those who stay. Boaz also signposts and connects clients to other specialist services such as dentists, GPs and solicitors.

We’ll provide a full package of support for host churches, including equipment, comprehensive training, personal and telephone support, as well as our years of experience in running night shelters.
serviceProviderSynopsis: Ending asylum destitution in the UK
customMessage: Host churches needed for @boaztrust women's night shelters

description: Donations for Coast to Coast fundraiser
reason:
H3 Coast to Coast Fundraiser - 
This bank holiday weekend Jak Davies, Iain Forrest and Molly Bishop will be cycling the breadth of the country in aid of the health and wellbeing work of H3 – Helping the Homeless into Housing. Completing the challenge over two days they will be stopping at St Peter’s Square on the Sunday morning to pick up anyone who wants to join for the last 50 miles.

H3 deliver a wide range of health and wellbeing activities to those living in temporary accommodation in Stockport. This includes cycling, arts and crafts, health advocacy, holistic therapies, football and fitness. Good health and wellbeing management is the cornerstone to leading a stable life and building independence. The more we can do in this area to support our most vulnerable residents, the greater our success will be to transform lives.

Donations to be made at https://localgiving.org/donation/h-3.

Please follow @H3homelessness on Twitter to follow the team as they ride across the country!

If you would like to join the ride on the Sunday please contact Jak at jak.davies@stockporthomes.org.
serviceProviderSynopsis: Helping the Homeless into Housing

reason:
The Booth Centre runs a busy day centre and needs to support with day to day maintenance jobs such as:
- Fixing door handles
- Fixing brackets or hooks in high areas
- Small electrical issues
- Fixing guttering
- Tiling 

Occasionally we have larger jobs such as:
- Plumber needed to look at boiler
- Replace a sink
- Outdoor Paving
- Plastering 
- Electrician to install plug sockets/computer points 

We are looking for a company who would be able to help us with these jobs as and when they arrive. We are not expecting a free service but want someone reliable and regular to provide quality support. If you have a company and would be able to support us in all or some of these areas please get in touch.
instructions:
Please contact the centre manager directly via james@boothcentre.org.uk
thank you

keywords: Cooler bag or box large or medium

reason:
Our Allotment is a place for our friends off the streets to get away from the city centre and engage in a completely different environment. There is chance to learn new skills, enjoy the company of fellow gardeners or just have a brew and a biscuit in a pleasant environment. 
Gardening itself is therapeutic and provides the volunteers with the chance to chat to our friends in a way that is different to our other projects.
Duties of a volunteer will be to help open up the allotment each week, serve hot drinks and snacks, get involved with gardening (no experience is necessary - we will train you), spend time with our friends off the streets, help our friends travel from our drop-in centre in the city centre, and help to keep the project clean and tidy.
instructions: These sessions happen on a Friday afternoon between 1pm and 2pm in Longsight. The project can be accessed via the 197 bus along Plymouth Grove or the 192 along Stockport Rd (the A6). Alternatively it is a 25 minute walk along Plymouth Grove from Upper Brook Street.
serviceProviderSynopsis: Christian homeless charity.

reason:
As a volunteer in our shop you will be assisting our Shop Manager with the general running of our Charity shop. Duties will include running the till, stock preparation, shop displays, stock sorting and managing the general cleanliness and tidiness of the shop.
Shifts are available Monday through Saturday either 10am to 2pm or 1pm to 5pm.
Help us raise the funds we need to do the vital work of the charity with those who are homeless in our city.
instructions: The shop is easily accessible on Wilmslow Road in Withington via any of the Oxford Rd/Wilmslow Rd Buses (141, 142, 143, 42, 43).
serviceProviderSynopsis: Christian homeless charity.

description: Volunteers for our ReNu Furniture Upcycling Project
reason:
Come and join our furniture upcycling project where you will get to work alongside those who are homeless or at risk of homelessness while they learn new skills and get re-acquainted with the world of work.
By volunteering on this project you will be hands-on working with the furniture, painting, learning upcycling skills as well as helping make lunch for our friends and keeping the workshop clean and tidy. 
A major part of your role will be to befriend those who are accessing the service - helping them in their work or helping them to travel there.
instructions:
ReNu is based in Sharston in Wythenshawe South Manchester and can be accessed via the no 43 bus (the Airport bus).
Being on our volunteer team you will need to complete our one-day training and have a DBS check (which we will pay for).
serviceProviderSynopsis: Christian homeless charity.

description: Volunteers for Drop-in Centre / Street Outreach
reason:
It is only possible to run our drop-in centre because of our fantastic team of volunteers! We also have teams of volunteers who go out on the streets to reach those who are most vulnerable.

Could you or someone you know volunteer with us at Barnabus during the day?
Morning Breakfast Drop-ins:
Monday - Friday 10am - 1.30pm
(including volunteers with catering experience)
These sessions provide food, clothing, showers and access to support workers - your role you could be helping in the kitchen serving hot drinks and breakfast or washing up, or you could be in our clothing area managing the distribution of clothes and the running of the showers. You can be on reception welcoming all our friends and registering them into our database or on the door making sure everyone is safe who wishes to access our services.
Afternoon activity sessions – including Art, IT, Cookery, Socials, God Slot and Ladies only sessions:
Monday - Friday 1.30pm - 4.30pm
At activity sessions we have brews and biscuits whilst working on an activity such as arts and crafts, IT, managing your money, a social activity or drama (activities are made available by our volunteers so if you have any special skills let us know). In these sessions you will be helping our friends off the streets to access the activity as well as serving drinks.
All of our team members attend a full training day and must complete a DBS check (paid for by Barnabus).

Our evening outreach volunteers go out onto the streets of Manchester to meet those who are sleeping on the streets, to build friendships and to encourage people to access support to find accommodation and to deal with any problems they might be facing.
Outreach sessions usually run from 7:30-9:30pm from Monday to Wednesday. All of our team members attend a full training day and must complete a DBS check (paid for by Barnabus).
instructions: Please email admin@barnabusmanchester.co.uk and we'll send you more information.
serviceProviderSynopsis: Christian homeless charity.
customMessage: Volunteers to help us run our Homeless Drop in Centre

reason:
Against a backdrop of national austerity, public service cuts and spiralling deprivation, Mustard Tree  is innovating, re-building, and upgrading to tackle poverty, inequality and disadvantage across our city. While our Ancoats building is structurally sound, it was never designed for the work we do. Without major refurbishments it would become soon become impossible to maintain our existing services, let alone meet the rising need we face on a day-to-day basis.  

We are undertaking major refurbishments at our hub in Ancoats and are looking for volunteers to help us move our training and catering facilities to a nearby building and create space for the refurbishments to begin.
instructions: Please complete the application form on our website and email to volunteering@mustardtree.co.uk, along with your availability.
serviceProviderSynopsis: We believe in a Greater Manchester where everyone has the opportunity to be a connected, valued, and contributing member of society.

reason:
We only have a fundraiser once a year to help with purchasing supplies.
It's a self funded organisation, for the times of the year when donations are scarce we need to be able to have funds to keep supplies in.

We are looking for someone who is passionate about helping homelessness, someone who is self motivated and has the time and energy to be able to put together a fundraising event.

If it's something for you or you're interested in knowing more please do contact us.

reason:

reason: Support for homeless people
serviceProviderSynopsis: Emmaus offers you a home, work in a social enterprise and an opportunity for you to gain confidence, training and any support you may need to live independently again. To join an Emmaus community you have to commit to working full-time in the social enterprise but the rewards for doing so are great. Help is available in things you wish to change in your life. This can cover anything – personal development, training, career development, and support to live independently. The community is a drug and alcohol free environment and we have access to alcohol and drugs support.

reason:
Every Tuesday from 10am-12pm, we provide a place for people who have additional barriers to moving on in life, such as homelessness, mental health issues, addiction recovery or a criminal record, get support in finding work.

People come to get help with lots of things.  It could be making their first CV in years, using the computer, preparing for a daunting interview or just getting a bit of encouragement.  Crucial to offering this support are our skills mentors, people from the community who give attendees a little focused time that goes a long way.

We are looking for more skills mentors to join our team.  If you can volunteer at least one Tuesday a month, are confident in using computers, good at talking to different people and want to support someone towards getting the job that could really change their lives, we would love to hear from you.

Time Commitment: We ask volunteers to commit a minimum of around one session a month which is based around our “Ready for Work” club. At our Ancoats Hub this is every Tuesday 10am-12pm.  We are still developing Ready for Work club at our Little Hulton base so a time and date is still to be confirmed.

Please get in touch if you're interested in volunteering in this role with us.
serviceProviderSynopsis: We believe in a Greater Manchester where everyone has the opportunity to be a connected, valued, and contributing member of society.

reason:
In collaboration with the New Islington Free School, we worked on an art installation called 'The Trees of Ancoats'  with the intention of brightening up the surrounding area of the school's new building. Our Creative Programmes Manager Graham initially came up with the idea of fusing nature and city life together and with the support of the pupils, teachers and our Freedom Project participants, pictures of trees were drawn in class and at Mustard Tree which were transferred onto large wooden boards. In addition to this, Graham talked to pupils about the importance of the environment, what trees do and why they are vital to every living creature on the planet. In total, 34 trees have been placed on the fences of the New Islington Free School which we hope will give Ancoats a fresh identity and encourage community spirit. 

We would like to frame the original art work produced by the the children and present each one to the children after exhibiting them both at Mustard Tree and at the school. We are looking for 69 A4 and 6 A3 size frames for the project so if this is something you can help with, please do get in touch!
serviceProviderSynopsis: We believe in a Greater Manchester where everyone has the opportunity to be a connected, valued, and contributing member of society.

reason: Greater Together Manchester runs a rolling winter night shelter in Manchester and Salford for 6 months of the year. It costs us £27 per guest per night to run this project. We provide more than just a bed, our project is run primarily by volunteers, who provide hospitality and safety for our guests.

reason:
We're looking for volunteers to help us by collecting food from FareShare in Openshaw and delivering it to Miles Platting on a Friday. We need someone who has their own car or van and is willing to receive FareShare training. Ideally we would like to find a couple of volunteers who are able to do this for us so we do not need to rely on the same person each week. 

The food collected will be used for our Night Shelter project and for Food4All (a project that feeds 70-90 homeless and vulnerably housed people each Sunday).

reason:
The James Hardy Music Studio aims to teach clients the skills needed to make their own music, by providing all the equipment and information they need. We hope that the process of making music will have a positive influence, helping clients become part of a community and family.

Main activities for the role include the following:

Fully trained in using Digital Audio Workstation; Reaper
Able to plan, teach and lead a 10-week music production course using
Have a passion for music and passing on your knowledge and skills to others
Time commitment: The weekly course will take place on Monday’s, 18:00 – 20:00 so we are looking for someone who can commit to this time.

Disclosure and Barring Service Check: A Disclosure and Barring Service Check (formerly CRB check) will be required as part of this role. This is free of charge for applicants.

Expenses: We are able to refund volunteers for travel expenses

Please apply by downloading an application form from our website and emailing to us.
serviceProviderSynopsis: We believe in a Greater Manchester where everyone has the opportunity to be a connected, valued, and contributing member of society.

reason:
We are moving our service users away from the Food Bank model towards our Food Club, which provides a food basket of 10 items for a membership fee of £2 per week, by redistributing surplus food stocks through Fareshare.

Your main task as a Food Club Assistant is to ensure that our clients have an enjoyable and educational experience when accessing our Food Club project. As part of this role, you will be expected to:

Buddy up with Freedom Project participants to develop new skills and achieve their personal development goals
Welcome and assist clients in choosing food from the Food Club
Enable clients to make healthier choices about the food they eat through the use of advice, recipe cards and demonstrations
Ensure goods are well displayed and inviting, following merchandising guidelines
Assist with regular stock checks, date checks and temperature checks
Be vigilant at all times and to help minimise stock loss
Time commitment: We are looking for volunteers who are able to commit to a day (or more) per week. This could be split across two morning or afternoon sessions. A normal working day is from 09:00 – 17:00.

Expenses: We are able to refund volunteers for travel expenses and provide lunch.

Please apply by downloading an application form from our website and emailing to us.
serviceProviderSynopsis: We believe in a Greater Manchester where everyone has the opportunity to be a connected, valued, and contributing member of society.

description: Customer Services Assistant – Ancoats, Eccles or Little Hulton
reason:
We currently operate 3 shops in Ancoats, Eccles & Little Hulton and offer a wide range of furniture, clothes and household goods. Some of the stock is new but the big majority is pre-loved at prices we believe are hard to match anywhere in Greater Manchester. Our shops operate as far more than just retail spaces being the entry point for people seeking support from one of the other services that Mustard Tree offers. They are the front door to our community, and we aim to treat everyone looking for support with dignity and care. The shops are looked after by our greatly valued volunteers, many of which have firstly come to as clients and who are enrolled on one of our life skills and employment programmes.

We are looking for people who are able to support our Retail team in the day to day running of our charity shop. Main activities include:

Act a buddy to Freedom Project participants to develop new skills and achieve their personal development goals (only in Ancoats and Little Hulton)

Welcome and advise customers and clients
Sort donations of clothing and homeware
Ensure goods are well displayed
Assist with regular stock checks
Operate the till and accurately handle payments
Answer the telephones
Book collections and deliveries in
Be vigilant at all times and to help minimise stock loss
Process food parcels

Time commitment: We are looking for volunteers who are able to commit to a day (or more) per week. This could be split across two morning or afternoon sessions. A normal working day is from 09:00 – 17:00.

Expenses: We are able to refund volunteers for travel expenses and provide lunch.

Please apply by downloading an application form from our website and emailing to us.
serviceProviderSynopsis: We believe in a Greater Manchester where everyone has the opportunity to be a connected, valued, and contributing member of society.

reason: Our early essentials team are needing formula milk for a lot of the families we are supporting. We are currently buying stock but any donations would be greatly appreciated
serviceProviderSynopsis: Outreach teams providing food and support for homeless people and sex workers. Also access to personal items including baby items and food parcels.

reason: We need men's jeans & joggers in sizes 30-34, new socks & boxers, trainers & jackets for clients. We can't store clothes that aren't needed so please check before bringing in any other items.
instructions: Drop off at the centre at 61 Bloom Street between Monday and Friday 10am - 3pm.
serviceProviderSynopsis: Christian homeless charity.

reason: Coffee4Craig aim to produce a newsletter once a month to inform all our supporters and volunteers about our progress and plans. We have a very small core team that run lots of projects including our street kitchens, so we need someone to help us do this.
instructions: The work would be to look through our social media and update emails from Hendrix and Risha, and curate a brief newsletter. We use Wix Shoutout to send emails out which is really simple to use. Maybe you can get a few friends together to do this between you. Contact from us if you are interested in helping.
serviceProviderSynopsis: Holistic homelessness support

reason: We need deodorants, razors, shower gels and shampoos to give to men that come into the centre.
instructions: Please drop off at the centre between 8am and 4pm Monday to Friday.
serviceProviderSynopsis: Day centre offering activities, advice and support to homeless people.

reason: We make a range of household items available to our clients in our shop so that they can set up their home.
instructions: Unfortunately we do not have the ability to collect any donated items so we ask that you deliver them to the day centre.
serviceProviderSynopsis: Adult day centre with a range of services

reason: We have clients without good levels of English that struggle to go through referral processes and into accommodation.
instructions: Please get in touch to find out more about the current opportunities and languages we need.
serviceProviderSynopsis: Drop-in centre for homeless people.

reason: We have many generous offers of volunteers but need to do DBS checks. If this could be provided for free, or at a reduced rate, it would be AMAZING!
instructions: Please get in touch to discuss.
serviceProviderSynopsis: Holistic homelessness support

reason: It would be really useful to have someone that can seek out suitable houses/flats for people that need to be re-homed as and when needed. This is a really important need, and one that takes a lot of time.
instructions: Please get in touch if you think you could help us with this.
serviceProviderSynopsis: Holistic homelessness support

reason: We always need disposable cups, bowls & cutlery for our street kitchen. This enables us to offer a warm meal to rough sleepers.
instructions: Please bring these items to the street kitchens near the cathedral, or get in touch to arrange delivery.
serviceProviderSynopsis: Holistic homelessness support

reason: We give out socks and boxers to rough sleepers. With little access to washing facilities these are items that are always needed.
instructions: Please get in touch if you have these to offer and we can arrange collection or discuss delivery details.
serviceProviderSynopsis: Holistic homelessness support

reason: We are always looking for volunteers with new skills to help at the Booth Centre.
instructions: Please check our volunteer section for more information.
serviceProviderSynopsis: Day centre offering activities, advice and support to homeless people.

description: Funding for our day centre and employment programmes
reason: We rely on public donations to continue our work providing drop in, support services, activities and employment programmes.
serviceProviderSynopsis: Day centre offering activities, advice and support to homeless people.

description: Coffee and Sugar and other food
reason: We regularly need these items for our drop-in centre.
instructions: Please deliver to the centre.
serviceProviderSynopsis: Day centre offering activities, advice and support to homeless people.

description: Socks, hats and gloves (but not other clothes)
reason: We need these items to give to rough sleepers. Please note we do not collect other clothes to hand out.
instructions: Please deliver to the Booth Centre
serviceProviderSynopsis: Day centre offering activities, advice and support to homeless people.

reason: A delivery of breakfast items such as eggs, bacon and sausage would allow us to provide a hot breakfast at our drop ins.
instructions: Please offer to deliver to our centre as a one off or on a regular basis
serviceProviderSynopsis: Day centre offering activities, advice and support to homeless people.

reason: Our building gets a lot of use, from drop ins, to training, to workshops and even opera! Someone to give the building a complete deep clean would be a huge help!
instructions: Deep clean the building once every 6 months.
serviceProviderSynopsis: Day centre offering activities, advice and support to homeless people.

reason: We have a wonderful building that needs a lot of looking after. Having these items would allow us to use donations directly for helping individuals.
instructions: We need floor cleaner, anti-bacterial spray, kitchen cleaner, cloths, and blue roll/toilet roll delivered.
serviceProviderSynopsis: Day centre offering activities, advice and support to homeless people.

reason:
Cornerstone is a day centre providing services to adults facing a wide range of social issues including homelessness, poverty, social isolation, poor mental health, drug and alcohol addiction. We operate an open door policy and welcome people from all backgrounds with our aim being to offer support to our clients, improve their prospects and enhance their quality of life.

We receive no public funds and are entirely dependent on grants from charitable trusts and individual donations.
serviceProviderSynopsis: Adult day centre with a range of services

description: Lentils, tea bags and tinned tomatoes.
reason: We often need food items and teabags to provide warm meals and drinks for the people we support.
instructions: Drop off at our centre Mon-Fri 10am-4pm, or email info@boaztrust.org.uk.
serviceProviderSynopsis: Ending asylum destitution in the UK

reason: We have a constant flow of new clients but not enough qualified or experienced volunteers available during the day, so if you are a social worker (for example) and would like to support us during the day to work with individuals, assisting them with appointments and the like...get in touch.
instructions: You will be required to provide evidence of experience, clean DBS and undergo an induction with additional training for this role.
serviceProviderSynopsis: Holistic homelessness support

description: Fresh food for 5 people for a week
reason: Please stand with us and help us bring hope to more asylum seekers and refugees. A gift of 25 will buy bedding for a destitute asylum seeker moving from street homelessness into the safety of one of our houses. A gift of £50 will pay for five asylum seekers to have fresh food for one week. A gift of 250 will buy fresh fruit, vegetables and basic toiletries for up to 30 asylum seekers who attend our monthly drop in.
serviceProviderSynopsis: Ending asylum destitution in the UK
